post: Meet BRIs 2025 Student Fellow, Mansi Bajaj! She is a high school junior from Aurora, Illinois. She is the vice president of her school's NEHS chapter and is the copy editor of her school's newspaper. Mansi has argued cases in the Illinois Supreme Court and has been awarded for her speaking and writing abilities. She is a dedicated student who excels in rigorous AP and honors classes. With her efforts, Mansi hopes to create meaningful change. BRIs Student Fellowship is a six-month educational program that helps high school students develop as leaders and develop skills in building civil society. Learn more about BRI's Student Fellowship!  https://bit.ly/3f2q66h

Join BRI's Tony Williams & political scientist and author Michael Nelson as they discuss FDR's court-packing plan and its significance in the history of American constitutional government. This episode of Scholar Talks focuses on FDRs leadership style, the reactions from Congress and the public, and the long-term impact of the plan on presidential power, party dynamics, and the balance among the three branches of government. Watch today!  https://bit.ly/3TtJjOR
